A **melon** is a type of [comestible](/wiki/Comestible "Comestible") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is [veggy](/wiki/Veggy "Veggy") and considered [vegan](/wiki/Vegan "Vegan").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 Variants](#Variants)

  - [5.1 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [5.2 SpliceHack](#SpliceHack)

- [6 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

- [7 References](#References)

## Generation

Melons make up 1⁄100 1% of all randomly-generated comestibles.

[Tourists](/wiki/Tourist "Tourist") can start with melons among their initial stacks of food.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

General [stores](/wiki/Store "Store"), delicatessens and health food stores can sell melons.

[Applying](/wiki/Apply "Apply") a [charged](/wiki/Charged "Charged") [horn of plenty](/wiki/Horn_of_plenty "Horn of plenty") has a 9⁄1000 chance (0.9%) of generating a melon or two.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

## Description

[Eating](/wiki/Eating "Eating") a melon grants 100 base [nutrition](/wiki/Nutrition "Nutrition") and takes 1 turn to consume.

[Throwing](/wiki/Throw "Throw") a melon will cause it to "splat" and be destroyed.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

## Strategy

Melons are a decent quick snack for most characters, but are no good for pacifying, taming or feeding [domestic animals](/wiki/Domestic_animal "Domestic animal"), since it will splatter instead of being caught.

The melon shares the same color glyph as the [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") of [Medusa](/wiki/Medusa "Medusa"), which has an outside chance of resulting in [YASD](/wiki/YASD "YASD") if the two are confused.

## History

The melon first appears in Hack for PDP-11, which is based on [Jay Fenlason's Hack](/wiki/Jay_Fenlason%27s_Hack "Jay Fenlason's Hack"), and is included in the initial food list for [Hack 1.0](/wiki/Hack_1.0 "Hack 1.0").

## Variants

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), the "Pacman" [random vault](/wiki/Random_vault_\(UnNetHack\) "Random vault (UnNetHack)") has a melon among the randomly placed 'fruit' items.

Both maps for the top floor of the [Ruins of Moria](/wiki/Ruins_of_Moria "Ruins of Moria") have a melon on the outside of the main gate, placed atop an [engraving](/wiki/Engraving "Engraving") that can only be read at night: "Speak, friend, and enter". This is a pun on "mellon", which is elvish for "friend" in [J.R.R. Tolkien](/wiki/J.R.R._Tolkien "J.R.R. Tolkien")'s setting of Middle-Earth.

### SpliceHack

In [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), the defunct [Dancer](/wiki/Dancer "Dancer") role starts the game with a melon among their initial food items.

## Encyclopedia entry

"What is it, Umbopa, son of a fool?" I shouted in Zulu.  
"It is food and water, Macumazahn," and again he waved the  
green thing.  
Then I saw what he had got. It was a melon. We had hit upon  
a patch of wild melons, thousands of them, and dead ripe.  
"Melons!" I yelled to Good, who was next me; and in another  
second he had his false teeth fixed in one.  
I think we ate about six each before we had done, and, poor  
fruit as they were, I doubt if I ever thought anything nicer.

\[ King Solomon's Mines, by H. Rider Haggard ]
